content: दिव् {vI.v} {c4c} <ab>P.</ab> (दीव्यति, द्यूत or द्यून; {%<ab>desid.</ab>%} दुद्यूषति, दिदेविषति) {@--1@} To shine, be bright. {@--2@} To throw, cast (as a missile); <ls>Bk. 17. 87</ls>, <ls n="Bk.">5. 81.</ls> {@--3@} To gamble, play with dice (with acc or <ab>instr.</ab> of the ‘dice’); अक्षैरक्षान्वा दीव्यति <ls>Sk.</ls>; <ls>Śi. 8. 32</ls>; <ls>Ve. 1. 13.</ls> {@--4@} To play, sport. {@--5@} To joke, trifle with, make sport of, rally; (with <ab>acc.</ab>). {@--6@} To stake, make a bet. {@--7@} To sell. deal in (with <ab>gen.</ab>); अदेवीद्वंधुभीगानां <ls>Bk. 8. 122</ls>; (but with <ab>acc.</ab> or <ab>gen.</ab> when the root is preceded by a preposition; शतं शतस्य वा परिदीव्यति <ls>Sk.</ls>). {@--8@} To squander, make light of. {@--9@} To praise. {@--10@} To be glad, rejoice. {@--11@} To be mad or drunk. {@--12@} To be sleepy. {@--13@} To wish for. {vII.v} {c1c} <ab>P.</ab> {c10c} <ab>U.</ab> (देवति, देवयति-ते) {@--1@} To cause to lament, pain, vex, torment. {@--2@} To ask, beg. {vIII.v} {c10c} <ab>A.</ab> (देवयते) To suffer pain, lament, moan. --WITH परि to lament, moan, suffer pain; <ls>Bk. 4. 34.</ls>

दिव् {%<ab>f.</ab>%} [दीव्यत्यत्र दिव्-बा °आधारे डिवि <ls>Tv.</ls>] (<ab>Nom.</ab> <ab>sing.</ab> द्यौः) {@--1@} The heaven; <ls>R. 3. 4</ls>, <ls n="R. 3.">12</ls>; <ls>Me. 30.</ls> {@--2@} The sky. {@--3@} A day. {@--4@} Light, brilliance. {@--5@} Fire, glow of fire. {%<ab>N. B.</ab>%} The compounds with दिव् as first member are mostly irregular; {%<ab>e. g.</ab>%} दिवस्पतिः an epithet of Indra; अनतिक्रमणीया दिवस्पतेराज्ञा <ls>Ś. 6.</ls> दिवस्पृथिव्यौ heaven and earth. दिविजः, दिविष्ठः, दिविस्थः, दिविस (ष) द् {%<ab>m.</ab>%}, दिवोकस् {%<ab>m.</ab>%}, दिवौकस्, --सः ‘inhabitant of the heaven’, a god; <ls>Ś. 7</ls>; <ls>R. 3. 19</ls>, <ls n="R. 3.">47</ls>; दिविषद्रवृंदैः <ls>Gīt. 7.</ls> दिवस्पृश् {%<ab>m.</ab>%} the Supreme Being. दिविस्पृश् {%<ab>a.</ab>%} reaching or pervading the sky. दिवोद्भवा cardamoms. दिवोल्का a meteor. दिवौकस् {%<ab>m.</ab>%} {1} a god. {2} the Cātaka bird. {3} a deer. {4} a bee. {5} an elephant.
